intro: Alectorolophus antiquus, commonly known as the ancient larkspur, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers are composed of five sepals that resemble petals, a feature common in the family. Alectorolophus antiquus is known for its ornamental value and has been cultivated for centuries in gardens and botanical collections.
